segment.source: ms.ContentId: 7dcd6da0-dd72-422d-8752-5eccc8116e02
segment.target: ms.ContentId: 7dcd6da0-dd72-422d-8752-5eccc8116e02

segment.source: title: Managing remote Hyper-V hosts
segment.target: title: Managing remote Hyper-V hosts

segment.source: Manage Remote Hyper-V Hosts with Hyper-V Manager
segment.target: Manage Remote Hyper-V Hosts with Hyper-V Manager

segment.source: 24-Nov update.
segment.target: 24-Nov update.

segment.source: Hyper-V Manager provides tools for diagnosing and managing your local Hyper-V host and a small number of remote hosts.
segment.target: Hyper-V Manager provides tools for diagnosing and managing your local Hyper-V host and a small number of remote hosts.

segment.source: This article documents the configuration steps for connecting to Hyper-V hosts using Hyper-V Manager in all supported configurations.
segment.target: This article documents the configuration steps for connecting to Hyper-V hosts using Hyper-V Manager in all supported configurations.

segment.source: To connect to a Hyper-V host in Hyper-V Manager, make sure Hyper-V Manager is selected in the left hand pane and then select Connect to Server... in the right-hand pane.
segment.target: To connect to a Hyper-V host in Hyper-V Manager, make sure Hyper-V Manager is selected in the left hand pane and then select Connect to Server... in the right-hand pane.

segment.source: Supported Hyper-V host combinations with Hyper-V Manager
segment.target: Supported Hyper-V host combinations with Hyper-V Manager

segment.source: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 10 allows you to manage:
segment.target: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 10 allows you to manage:

segment.source: Windows 10
segment.target: Windows 10

segment.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts
segment.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts

segment.source: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts
segment.target: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts

segment.source: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 allows you to manage:
segment.target: Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 allows you to manage:

segment.source: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts
segment.target: Windows 8.1 and Windows Server 2012 R2 Hyper-V hosts

segment.source: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts
segment.target: Windows 8 and Windows 2012 Hyper-V hosts

segment.source: Note: Not all Hyper-V Manager functionality works for all host versions.
segment.target: Note: Not all Hyper-V Manager functionality works for all host versions.

segment.source: Manage localhost
segment.target: Manage localhost

segment.source: To add localhost to Hyper-V Manager as a Hyper-V host, select Local computer in the Select Computer dialogue box.
segment.target: To add localhost to Hyper-V Manager as a Hyper-V host, select Local computer in the Select Computer dialogue box.

segment.source: If a connection can't be established:
segment.target: If a connection can't be established:

segment.source: Make sure the Hyper-V server role is enabled.
segment.target: Make sure the Hyper-V server role is enabled.

segment.source: See the walkthrough section for checking compatability.
segment.target: See the walkthrough section for checking compatability.

segment.source: Confirm that your user account is part of the Hyper-V Administrator group.
segment.target: Confirm that your user account is part of the Hyper-V Administrator group.

segment.source: Manage a Hyper-V host in your domain
segment.target: Manage a Hyper-V host in your domain

segment.source: To add a remote Hyper-V host to Hyper-V Manager, select Another computer in the Select Computer dialogue box and enter the remote host's hostname, NetBIOS, or FQDN into the text field.
segment.target: To add a remote Hyper-V host to Hyper-V Manager, select Another computer in the Select Computer dialogue box and enter the remote host's hostname, NetBIOS, or FQDN into the text field.

segment.source: Windows 10 greatly expanded the possible combinations of remote connection types.
segment.target: Windows 10 greatly expanded the possible combinations of remote connection types.

segment.source: Now you can connect to a remote Windows 10 or later host using either the host name or IP address.
segment.target: Now you can connect to a remote Windows 10 or later host using either the host name or IP address.

segment.source: Hyper-V Manager now supports alternate credentials as well.
segment.target: Hyper-V Manager now supports alternate credentials as well.

segment.source: In order to manage remote Hyper-V hosts, remote management must be enabled on both computers.
segment.target: In order to manage remote Hyper-V hosts, remote management must be enabled on both computers.

segment.source: You can do this through or by running the following PowerShell command as Administrator:
segment.target: You can do this through or by running the following PowerShell command as Administrator:

segment.source: If your current user account matches a Hyper-V Administrator account on the remote host, go ahead and press OK to Connect.
segment.target: If your current user account matches a Hyper-V Administrator account on the remote host, go ahead and press OK to Connect.

segment.source: This is the only supported way to manage a remote host in Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8 or Windows 8.1.
segment.target: This is the only supported way to manage a remote host in Hyper-V Manager in Windows 8 or Windows 8.1.

segment.source: Connect to the remote host as a different user
segment.target: Connect to the remote host as a different user

segment.source: In Windows 10, if you are not running with the correct user account for the remote host, you can connect as another user with alternate credentials.
segment.target: In Windows 10, if you are not running with the correct user account for the remote host, you can connect as another user with alternate credentials.

segment.source: To specify credentials for the remote Hyper-V host, select **Connect as another user: ** in the Select Computer dialogue box then select Set User....
segment.target: To specify credentials for the remote Hyper-V host, select **Connect as another user: ** in the Select Computer dialogue box then select Set User....

segment.source: Note: It's very easy to forget to set the user and click OK with user not specified.
segment.target: Note: It's very easy to forget to set the user and click OK with user not specified.

segment.source: If your connection fails, make sure you actually did set the user.
segment.target: If your connection fails, make sure you actually did set the user.

segment.source: Connect to the remote host using IP address
segment.target: Connect to the remote host using IP address

segment.source: Sometimes it's easier to connect using IP address rather than host name.
segment.target: Sometimes it's easier to connect using IP address rather than host name.

segment.source: Windows 10 allows your to do just that.
segment.target: Windows 10 allows your to do just that.

segment.source: To connect using IP address, enter the IP address into the Another Computer text field.
segment.target: To connect using IP address, enter the IP address into the Another Computer text field.

segment.source: Manage a Hyper-V host outside your domain (or with no domain)
segment.target: Manage a Hyper-V host outside your domain (or with no domain)

segment.source: Local Hyper-V Host:
segment.target: Local Hyper-V Host:

segment.source: Enable-PSRemoting
segment.target: Enable-PSRemoting

segment.source: Came back with netowork set to public.
segment.target: Came back with netowork set to public.

segment.source: Ran
segment.target: Ran

segment.source: Set-NetConnectionProfile -Name "name" -NetworkCategory private
segment.target: Set-NetConnectionProfile -Name "name" -NetworkCategory private

segment.source: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force
segment.target: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force

segment.source: Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role client -DelegateComputer *
segment.target: Enable-WSManCredSSP -Role client -DelegateComputer *

segment.source: For workgroup only:
segment.target: For workgroup only:

segment.source: (should be done) Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* ].
segment.target: (should be done) Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* ].

segment.source: To list of computers, check the box forConcatenate OS defaults with input above
segment.target: To list of computers, check the box forConcatenate OS defaults with input above

segment.source: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials with NTLM-only server authentication → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* to list of computers, check the box for Concatenate OS defaults with input above
segment.target: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\System\Credentials Delegation\Allow Delegating Fresh Credentials with NTLM-only server authentication → Set to enabled and add WSMAN/* to list of computers, check the box for Concatenate OS defaults with input above

segment.source: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Allow CredSSP authentication → Set to enabled
segment.target: Computer Policy\Administrative Templates\Windows Components\Windows Remote Management (WinRM)\WinRM Client\Allow CredSSP authentication → Set to enabled

segment.source: Remote Hyper-V Host:
segment.target: Remote Hyper-V Host:

segment.source: Disabled the firewall :)
segment.target: Disabled the firewall :)

segment.source: Enable-PSRemoting
segment.target: Enable-PSRemoting

segment.source: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force
segment.target: Set-Item WSMan:\localhost\Client\TrustedHosts * -Force

segment.source: So that's the demo-only instructions I used.
segment.target: So that's the demo-only instructions I used.

segment.source: Replace * and turn off firewall with a single computer and letting credssp and winRM through
segment.target: Replace * and turn off firewall with a single computer and letting credssp and winRM through
